Lactose-Free Creamy Tomato Basil Soup

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the world of comforting flavors with our delightful Lactose-Free Creamy Tomato Basil Soup! Perfectly balanced with the sweetness of ripe tomatoes, the aromatic essence of fresh basil, and a rich creaminess from coconut milk, this soup is a fantastic choice for anyone looking to enjoy a hearty yet lactose-free meal. Whether you are lactose intolerant or simply seeking a lighter alternative to traditional creamy soups, this recipe is easy to whip up and sure to satisfy. With just a handful of simple ingredients like canned crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, and fresh basil, you can create a warm, inviting dish that will impress family and friends alike. Plus, it’s not just delicious - it’s also packed with nutrients, making it a perfect option for a healthy lunch or dinner. So grab your pot and let’s dive into the comforting world of creamy tomato basil soup!

Ingredients

canned crushed tomatoes

Opt for whole peeled tomatoes if you want to control the texture; simply crush them by hand or with a fork after cooking. Look for brands with no added sugars or preservatives for a cleaner flavor. If you prefer a fresher taste, you can use fresh tomatoes (about 2 pounds), just peel and chop them before adding.

vegetable broth

Choose a low-sodium vegetable broth to control the saltiness of your soup. If you don’t have vegetable broth, you can substitute it with water mixed with bouillon cubes or homemade broth for a richer flavor. For a twist, use mushroom broth to add depth.

coconut milk (canned)

Full-fat coconut milk gives a creamier texture; light coconut milk can be used for fewer calories but may affect creaminess. If you prefer a different flavor, consider using cashew cream or almond milk, but adjust the seasoning as these are less rich.

fresh basil leaves

Fresh basil is essential for brightness; if unavailable, use 1-2 teaspoons of dried basil. To enhance flavor, you can chiffonade the basil leaves (stack, roll, and slice finely) before adding them to the soup. Adding basil towards the end of cooking preserves its fresh flavor.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil is best for flavor; however, you can substitute with avocado oil or grapeseed oil for a higher smoke point. For extra flavor, consider infusing the oil with herbs or garlic before adding it to the pot.

garlic cloves, minced

Fresh garlic is more potent than pre-minced; adjust the amount according to your taste. If you love garlic, consider roasting it first for a sweeter flavor. For a milder garlic taste, use garlic powder instead, about 1/2 teaspoon for each clove.

salt

Start with a small amount, especially if using broth that contains salt, and adjust to taste. Consider using sea salt or kosher salt for a cleaner flavor. For an alternative, use lemon juice or a splash of vinegar to enhance the overall taste without adding more salt.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper adds more flavor than pre-ground. If you want a bit of heat, try adding crushed red pepper flakes or a dash of cayenne pepper for a kick.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Heat the Olive Oil

    In a large pot, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. This will serve as the base for your soup, providing rich flavor and a healthy fat content.

  • Step 2: Sauté the Garlic

    Add 2 minced garlic cloves to the pot and sauté for about 1 minute, stirring constantly until fragrant. Be careful not to burn the garlic, as it can turn bitter. This step infuses the oil with a delicious garlic flavor.

  • Step 3: Combine Tomatoes and Broth

    Pour in 2 cans (15 oz each) of canned crushed tomatoes and 2 cups of vegetable broth into the pot. Stir well to combine all the ingredients. This mixture forms the heart of your soup, so ensure everything is well blended.

  • Step 4: Simmer the Mixture

    Bring the soup to a simmer and allow it to cook for about 10 minutes. This helps to meld the flavors together and brings out the natural sweetness of the tomatoes.

  • Step 5: Add Coconut Milk and Basil

    Stir in 1 cup of canned coconut milk and 1/2 cup of fresh basil leaves into the pot. The coconut milk adds a creamy texture while keeping the soup lactose-free. Fresh basil adds a vibrant flavor.

  • Step 6: Blend the Soup

    Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until smooth. If you don't have an immersion blender, carefully transfer the soup in batches to a regular blender. Always allow the soup to cool slightly before blending to avoid splatter.

  • Step 7: Season and Heat Through

    After blending, season the soup with salt and black pepper to taste. Return the pot to low heat and let it cook for an additional 5 minutes. This step ensures the flavors are balanced and the soup is heated through.

  • Step 8: Serve and Garnish

    Serve the creamy tomato basil soup hot. For an extra touch, garnish with additional fresh basil leaves on top. Enjoy your delicious and healthy meal!

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to prepare garlic for cooking?

To prepare garlic, start by removing the outer skin. You can crush the clove slightly with the flat side of a knife to make peeling easier. Then, mince it by chopping it finely. Fresh garlic adds a wonderful flavor to your dishes!

How do I know when the olive oil is hot enough to add ingredients?

You can test if the olive oil is hot enough by adding a small piece of garlic. If it sizzles immediately, the oil is ready. This helps prevent the oil from smoking and burning.

How do I blend the soup without a fancy blender?

An immersion blender is perfect for blending soups directly in the pot. If you don’t have one, you can carefully transfer the soup in batches to a regular blender. Just be cautious with hot liquids!

What can I use instead of fresh basil if I don’t have any?

If you don’t have fresh basil, dried basil can be used as a substitute. Use about 1 tablespoon of dried basil for this recipe, but add it earlier in the cooking process to allow the flavors to develop.

Can I adjust the thickness of the soup?

Yes! If you prefer a thinner soup, you can add more vegetable broth or water until you reach your desired consistency. For a thicker soup, simply reduce the amount of broth.

How do I know when the soup is seasoned correctly?

Taste the soup after adding salt and pepper. Start with a little, stir, and taste again. Remember, you can always add more, but you can’t take it out!

Is it safe to eat leftover soup? How should I store it?

Absolutely! Let the soup cool down before transferring it to an airtight container. Store it in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days or freeze it for longer storage. Just make sure to reheat it thoroughly before serving.

What if I don’t have canned crushed tomatoes?

If you don’t have crushed tomatoes, you can use whole canned tomatoes and blend them until smooth, or use fresh tomatoes (about 4-5 medium-sized) that have been peeled and chopped.

How do I safely handle hot liquids when cooking?

Always use oven mitts or pot holders when handling hot pots. When blending hot soup, allow it to cool slightly to avoid splattering. If using a regular blender, fill it only halfway and remove the center cap to let steam escape.

Can I add other vegetables to the soup?

Definitely! You can add vegetables like onions, carrots, or bell peppers for more flavor and nutrition. Just sauté them along with the garlic before adding the tomatoes and broth.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This soup is naturally lactose-free, making it suitable for those with lactose intolerance. It's also vegan, as it contains no animal products. For gluten-free diets, ensure that the vegetable broth is certified gluten-free. If you're looking to add protein, consider incorporating some cooked lentils or chickpeas into the soup without compromising its creamy texture. To lower the calorie content, use light coconut milk or substitute with more vegetable broth.

Pairings

This creamy tomato basil soup pairs wonderfully with a variety of accompaniments. Consider serving it with a grilled cheese sandwich made with lactose-free cheese for a classic comfort food experience. Alternatively, offer a side of crusty whole-grain bread or garlic bread for dipping. For a heartier option, pair it with a simple green salad dressed with a light vinaigrette. As for beverages, a crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a light-bodied red such as Pinot Noir complements the flavors beautifully. For non-alcoholic options, a sparkling water with a splash of lemon or a herbal iced tea works well.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the creamy tomato basil soup hot in bowls, garnished with a drizzle of additional coconut milk or a sprinkle of fresh basil leaves for a pop of color. For an upscale presentation, consider serving the soup in individual rustic mugs or cups, allowing guests to enjoy it as a casual yet elegant option. Top each serving with freshly cracked black pepper and a pinch of sea salt for added flavor. To enhance the dining experience, offer a small platter of toppings on the side, such as croutons, nutritional yeast, or a sprinkle of red pepper flakes for those who enjoy a bit of heat.

Lactose-Free Creamy Tomato Basil Soup

30 min
$8.5
220 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

Coconut

Dietary Tags:

Lactose-FreeVeganGluten-Free

Cuisine:

Course:

SoupAppetizer

Tags:

SoupVeganQuick Meal

Description

A rich and velvety tomato soup infused with fresh basil, perfect for a cozy meal.

Ingredients

  • canned crushed tomatoes: 2 cans (15 oz each)
  • vegetable broth: 2 cups
  • coconut milk (canned): 1 cup
  • fresh basil leaves: 1/2 cup
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • garlic cloves, minced: 2
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
